revisions.*:
'''Andreas Tømmerbakke''' (24 July 1910 – 3 November 1994) was a Norwegian [[actuary]] and [[Norwegian resistance movement|resistance member]].

He was born in [[Bergen]], and [[examen artium|finished]] his secondary education at [[Bergen Cathedral School]] in 1929. He studied at the [[University of Oslo|Royal Frederick University]] and graduated with the [[cand.oecon.]] degree in 1934. In 1935 he took the [[Actuarial exam|actuary examination]]. He worked in the insurance company Norske Forenede Livsforsikringsselskap from 1936 to 1947, [[Statens Kornforretning]] from 1947 to 1952 and then in the [[Norwegian Ministry of Defence]].<ref name=obit>{{cite news|title=Andreas Tømmerbakke (obituary)|work=Aftenposten|first=Odd|last=Øyen|authorlink=Odd Øyen|author2=Welle-Strand, Erling |authorlink2=Erling Welle-Strand |page=|date=21 November 1994|language=Norwegian}}</ref>

During the [[occupation of Norway by Nazi Germany]] he was a member of [[Milorg]]. He was one of the closest helpers of [[Lorentz Brinch]], leader of District 13 based in Norway's capital.<ref name=milorg-pg54>{{cite book|title=Milorg D13 i kamp. Fra det hemmelige militære motstandsarbeidet i Oslo og omegn 1940–1945|author=[[Odd Øyen|Øyen, Odd]]; [[Finn Ramsøy|Ramsøy, Finn]]; Tømmerbakke, Andreas|publisher=Orion|location=Oslo|date=2007|edition=2nd|page=32|isbn=978-82-458-0839-1|language=Norwegian}}</ref> Brinch, Tømmerbakke and [[Reidun Røed|Reidun Hjartøy]] were the three people usually present at the district's main office, where sub-leaders (intelligence, weapons, sabotage, provisions) filed reports during the day.<ref>Øyen et al, 2007: p. 34</ref> After the war he co-edited the book ''Milorg D13 i kamp. Fra det hemmelige militære motstandsarbeidet i Oslo og omegn 1940–1945 ''. He died in November 1994.<ref name=obit/>
